metadata.subject: physics
metadata.dotPoint: Analyse the use of an electric field to accelerate a charge, including: electric field and electric force concepts, potential energy changes in a uniform electric field, the magnitude of the force on a charged particle

uniform_electric_field.name: Uniform Electric Field
uniform_electric_field.correct: A uniform electric field has constant magnitude and direction at all points. Between parallel plates: E = V/d.

E = Vd.fix: E = V/d. Voltage divided by distance, not multiplied.
E = Vd.action: Check units: V/m gives N/C or V/m, which are correct units for E.

E = d/V.fix: E = V/d. Larger voltage over same distance gives stronger field.
E = d/V.action: Double the voltage, double the field strength. That requires V in numerator.

E = kQ/r².error: That's for point charges, not parallel plates.
E = kQ/r².fix: E = kQ/r² is for point charges. E = V/d is for uniform fields between plates.
E = kQ/r².action: Know both: point charge uses 1/r², parallel plates use V/d.

persistent.gap: You're confusing uniform field and point charge formulas.
persistent.action: Make a table: Parallel plates → E = V/d (uniform). Point charge → E = kQ/r² (radial).

electric_force_formula.name: Electric Force Formula
electric_force_formula.correct: The force on a charge in an electric field is F = qE. Force is proportional to both charge and field strength.

F = qV.error: That gives work done, not force.
F = qV.fix: F = qE is force. W = qV is work (energy).
F = qV.action: Force needs field strength E. Work needs potential difference V.

F = E/q.error: Inverted. Force is qE, not E/q.
F = E/q.fix: F = qE. More charge means more force, so q multiplies E.
F = E/q.action: Double the charge, double the force. That requires multiplication.

F = qEd.error: That's the work formula, not force.
F = qEd.fix: W = qEd (work = force × distance). F = qE (just force).
F = qEd.action: Force doesn't include distance. Work = Force × distance.

persistent.gap: You're mixing up force, work, and energy formulas.
persistent.action: Memorise: F = qE (force), W = qEd = qV (work/energy).

coulombs_law.name: Coulomb's Law
coulombs_law.correct: The force between two point charges: F = kq₁q₂/r². Force follows inverse square law with distance.

F = kq₁q₂/r.fix: It's inverse SQUARE law: F = kq₁q₂/r².
F = kq₁q₂/r.action: Double the distance, force becomes 1/4, not 1/2.

F = kq₁q₂r².fix: F = kq₁q₂/r². Force DECREASES with distance.
F = kq₁q₂r².action: Charges further apart feel less force. r² must be in denominator.

F = Gq₁q₂/r².error: G is for gravity, k is for electricity.
F = Gq₁q₂/r².fix: Coulomb's law uses k (Coulomb constant). Newton's uses G (gravitational constant).
F = Gq₁q₂/r².action: k goes with charges. G goes with masses.

persistent.gap: You're confusing gravitational and electric force formulas.
persistent.action: Compare: F = kq₁q₂/r² (electric) vs F = Gm₁m₂/r² (gravity). Same structure, different constants.

electric_field_direction.name: Electric Field Direction
electric_field_direction.correct: Electric field points away from positive charges and toward negative charges. Field shows direction of force on a positive test charge.

toward positive charges.fix: Field points AWAY from positive charges. Positive test charge is repelled by positive source.
toward positive charges.action: Place a + test charge near +. It's repelled, so field points away from source.

away from negative charges.fix: Field points TOWARD negative charges. Positive test charge is attracted to negative source.
away from negative charges.action: Place a + test charge near −. It's attracted, so field points toward source.

in the direction of electron motion.error: Electrons are negative. They move opposite to field direction.
in the direction of electron motion.fix: Field direction = direction a POSITIVE charge would move. Electrons move opposite.
in the direction of electron motion.action: Electrons are negative, so they feel force opposite to E. Don't define field by electron motion.

persistent.gap: You're not using the positive test charge convention for field direction.
persistent.action: Remember: field direction = force direction on a POSITIVE test charge. Always.

work_in_electric_field.name: Work Done in Electric Field
work_in_electric_field.correct: Work done on a charge: W = qEd (force × distance) or W = qV (charge × voltage). Both are equivalent.

W = Ed.fix: W = qEd. Work depends on how much charge is being moved.
W = Ed.action: Move twice the charge through same field → twice the work.

W = qE.fix: F = qE is force. W = qEd includes distance moved.
W = qE.action: Work = Force × distance. W = (qE) × d = qEd.

W = V/q.error: Inverted. Work is qV, not V/q.
W = V/q.fix: W = qV. More charge moved through same voltage = more work.
W = V/q.action: Voltage is work per unit charge. W = qV gives total work.

persistent.gap: You're confusing force, work, and voltage relationships.
persistent.action: Chain: F = qE → W = Fd = qEd → Since V = Ed, W = qV.

potential_difference.name: Potential Difference (Voltage)
potential_difference.correct: Voltage is work per unit charge, or electric field times distance: V = Ed = W/q.

V = E/d.action: Larger distance between plates at same E gives larger V.

V = qE.fix: F = qE is force. V = Ed is voltage (no charge term).
V = qE.action: Voltage describes the field, independent of what charge you put in it.

V = qW.fix: Voltage is work PER unit charge. Divide work by charge.
V = qW.action: Units: J/C = V. Work divided by charge gives voltage.

persistent.gap: You don't understand voltage as work per unit charge.
persistent.action: Definition: 1 Volt = 1 Joule per Coulomb. V = W/q follows directly.

kinetic_energy_gain.name: Kinetic Energy from Electric Field
kinetic_energy_gain.correct: A charge accelerated from rest through voltage V gains kinetic energy: ½mv² = qV.

½mv² = qE.error: E is field strength, not energy. Need voltage V.
½mv² = qE.fix: ½mv² = qV. The V is potential difference, not field strength E.
½mv² = qE.action: qE gives force. qV gives energy.

mv² = qV.error: Missing the ½ in kinetic energy.
mv² = qV.fix: KE = ½mv², not mv². Don't forget the half.
mv² = qV.action: ½mv² = qV. Both sides must be energy in Joules.

½mv² = qEd².fix: W = qEd, so ½mv² = qEd. No square on d.
½mv² = qEd².action: Work = Force × distance, not force × distance².

persistent.gap: You're making algebraic errors with the energy equation.
persistent.action: Start from W = qV and KE = ½mv². Equate them: ½mv² = qV.

electron_in_field.name: Electron Behavior in Electric Fields
electron_in_field.correct: An electron (negative charge) accelerates toward the positive plate, opposite to the field direction.

toward the negative plate.error: Electrons are negative; they're attracted to positive.
toward the negative plate.fix: Opposite charges attract. Electron (−) moves toward positive plate.
toward the negative plate.action: Like repels, opposite attracts. − goes to +.

in the direction of the field.error: Electrons move opposite to field direction.
in the direction of the field.fix: E-field shows force direction on positive charges. Electrons feel opposite force.
in the direction of the field.action: F = qE. For negative q, force is opposite to E.

it remains stationary.error: Any charge in a field experiences a force.
it remains stationary.fix: F = qE. Non-zero charge in non-zero field = non-zero force.
it remains stationary.action: Only zero charge or zero field gives zero force.

persistent.gap: You're not correctly applying force direction to negative charges.
persistent.action: Rule: positive charges move with field, negative charges move against field.

proton_in_field.name: Proton Behavior in Electric Fields
proton_in_field.correct: A proton (positive charge) accelerates toward the negative plate, in the direction of the electric field.

toward the positive plate.error: Protons are positive; they're repelled by positive.
toward the positive plate.fix: Like charges repel. Proton (+) moves away from + plate, toward − plate.
toward the positive plate.action: Positive charge moves in direction of E field.

opposite to the field direction.error: Positive charges move WITH the field.
opposite to the field direction.fix: E-field direction = force direction on positive charges. Protons move with E.
opposite to the field direction.action: Field is defined by positive test charge behavior.

faster than an electron through same vol.error: Mass matters. Protons are heavier, so slower.
faster than an electron through same vol.fix: Same qV gives same KE, but heavier proton has lower speed: v = √(2qV/m).
faster than an electron through same vol.action: KE = ½mv². For same KE, larger m means smaller v.

persistent.gap: You're confusing charge sign effects with mass effects.
persistent.action: Charge sign → direction. Mass → speed. Both matter.

parallel_plate_field.name: Electric Field Between Parallel Plates
parallel_plate_field.correct: Between parallel plates, the field is uniform—same strength and direction everywhere. E = V/d.

stronger near the positive plate.error: That's for point charges. Parallel plates give uniform field.
stronger near the positive plate.fix: Uniform means same everywhere between the plates.
stronger near the positive plate.action: Draw parallel, equally-spaced field lines. That's uniform.

zero in the middle.error: Field is constant between plates, not zero.
zero in the middle.fix: Uniform field means E is the same at every point between plates.
zero in the middle.action: Test charge feels same force anywhere between the plates.

depends on position.fix: E = V/d gives one value for the whole region between plates.
depends on position.action: This is what makes uniform fields simple—no position dependence.

persistent.gap: You're treating uniform fields like radial fields.
persistent.action: Draw both: point charge (radial, varies with r) vs plates (parallel, constant).

energy_conservation.name: Energy Conservation in Electric Fields
energy_conservation.correct: In an electric field, electrical potential energy converts to kinetic energy: PE lost = KE gained.

energy is created by the field.fix: The field stores PE. Acceleration converts PE to KE.
energy is created by the field.action: Total energy is constant. PE decreases, KE increases.

KE converts to PE when accelerating.fix: When speeding up, KE increases. That energy comes from PE decreasing.
KE converts to PE when accelerating.action: Falling in gravity: PE → KE. Same for charges in E fields.

work done equals force.fix: W = Fd. Work has units of energy (Joules), force has units of Newtons.
work done equals force.action: Work = Force × distance = qE × d = qEd = qV.

persistent.gap: You don't understand energy transformation in fields.
persistent.action: Trace the energy: charge in field has PE. Accelerate → PE → KE. Total constant.

acceleration_calculation.name: Acceleration in Electric Field
acceleration_calculation.correct: Acceleration of a charged particle: a = F/m = qE/m. Depends on charge-to-mass ratio.

a = qE.error: That's force, not acceleration. Missing divide by mass.
a = qE.fix: F = qE, then a = F/m = qE/m.
a = qE.action: Newton's second law: a = F/m. Don't forget the mass.

a = qEm.fix: a = qE/m. More mass means less acceleration.
a = qEm.action: Heavier object accelerates slower under same force.

a = qV/m.fix: a = qE/m (using field) or use energy: ½mv² = qV for final speed.
a = qV/m.action: Force uses E. Energy uses V. Don't mix them.

persistent.gap: You're confusing force, energy, and acceleration calculations.
persistent.action: Two approaches: (1) a = F/m = qE/m, or (2) ½mv² = qV then find v.
